twitter_bot.common module¶

::Author: Noel Wilson (jwnwilson@hotmai.co.uk)

Simple twitter application only based authentication, doesn’t store the access token.

twitter_bot.common.get_hash_tag_most_typos(hash_tag_battle)[source]¶

Return the hash tag object with the most typos :param hash_tag_battle: :return:

twitter_bot.common.get_hash_tag_typos(hash_tag_battle)[source]¶

Return the hash tag object with the most typos :param hash_tags: :return:

twitter_bot.common.get_tweet_typos(tweet)[source]¶

Return a list of typos found in hash_tag string :param hash_tags: :return:

twitter_bot.common.get_tweets_by_hash_tag(hash_tag, start_date_time, end_data_time)[source]¶

Get tweets by hash tag between start and end datetime :param hash_tag: string, hash tag to get tweets for :param start_date_time: datetime, get tweets with created_at older or equal to start_date_time :param end_data_time: datetime, get tweets with created_at before or equal to end_date_time :return: Queryset, tweets returned

twitter_bot.common.get_tweets_data_for_hash_tag_from_twitter(hash_tag)[source]¶

Get tweets by hash tag data from twitter :param hash_tag: :return:

twitter_bot.views module¶

codeauthor:: Noel Wilson <jwnwilson@hotmail.co.uk> Date: 22/01/2016

Main views for the twitter box

twitter_bot.views.hash_tag_battle(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple view to get the hash tag battle by id then search for hash tags and compare typos in all the tweets :param request: :return:

twitter_bot.views.home(request)[source]¶

Index page to test development on docker :param request: :return:

twitter_bot.wsgi module¶

It exposes the WSGI callable as a module-level variable named application.
